## Core Architecture & Performance Strategy

The platform requires a **geographically distributed architecture** with regional data centers to minimize latency for global participants. Each region hosts:
- WebRTC signaling servers for peer-to-peer video establishment
- Media relay servers (TURN/STUN) for NAT traversal
- Application servers for session management
- CDN edge nodes for content delivery

- Dynamic switching based on participant count and network conditions

- Simulcast from speakers, allowing receivers to select optimal quality

- Moderation logs and flags

Mock news sites use **push-based distribution** with WebSocket connections for real-time updates, complemented by aggressive CDN caching for media assets.

- Video servers scale based on concurrent connections (target: 80% CPU utilization)

- Each SFU server handles maximum 100 concurrent streams
